docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Department Inquiry Examines Medical Supplies The Justice Department has opened a broad criminal investigation of the medical supply industry, apparently to determine whether Medicare and other federal and state health programs are being overcharged for goods like rubber gloves, drugs and X-ray machines. More than a dozen medical supply companies have recently received federal subpoenas in what appears to be a wide-ranging investigation into the way suppliers market their products to clinics, hospitals and nursing homes that serve Medicare and Medicaid patients and whether those institutions properly account for the purchases. [Page A1.]
